scenario_text.value: This is just awful... How could they do this?

Hold yourself together, Aoi. We’ve gotta save
the injured ones!
Ah, yes, you’re right. We have a job to do.

I won’t forgive the ones who hurt these poor
babies...
Aoi...

(Aoi’s pretty upset. Still, giving in to her
anger could affect Labramon in a bad way.)
(I should try to calm her down, but...)
(How can I get Aoi to calm down?)
Tell her to stay calm.
Give no time to think.
Focus her on our task.
Calm her down.

I totally get why you’re upset, Aoi. Still,
try to stay calm.
Oh, I’m calm, Takuma.

I’m just here to do what I have to.
Don’t worry.

(Your eyes tell a different story, Aoi... I’m
getting shivers over here.)
Give no time to think.

(If I make her pick up the pace, she won’t
have time to think about anything else.)
Aoi, please take care of this child’s wounds!
And this one, too!
Huh? Wait, I can’t handle both at once...
I’ll help, Aoi. Let’s do what we can!

Yes, you’re right. Okay, I’ll focus on
treating them.
Thanks for that, Takuma.
You got it.
Focus her on our task.

I totally get why you’re upset, Aoi. Still,
we ought to focus on treating these guys.
Of course. I get that.

Plus, you know what might happen if our
emotions come unbalanced...
Ah...

Yes, you’re right. They’ll negatively
influence the Kemono... How thoughtless...

Thank you, Takuma. I’ll focus on the task at
hand.
Yeah, let’s do what we can.

(I’ll leave treating of the injured here to
Aoi.)

Let’s look around the park, see if anyone
else is hurt.
Yeah!

I’ll focus on taking care of these little
ones. The rest of you check out the park.
